_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Administrative controls (Operating procedures, speed limit, etc.) in place and in-line excess flow automatic shutdown valves.
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Routine Visual inspections by trained operators
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Add pull-away protection to loading hose connection
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Storage tank, piping, and relief valves

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.

5. Emergency Action Plan.
The facility has:

    a.     A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 
                   29 CFR 1910.38;

    b.     Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and 
                   Community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III 
                   (EPCRA).

    c.     If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, 
                   the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and 
                   call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our
                   Emergency Action Plan.

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety.
Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of this facility.  The faciity is planning on adding pull-away protection to the hose loading connection.

WinField United
EPA FACILITY ID: 1000 0012 4563
Cimarron, Ks.

1. Facility Policy
We are committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by continually improving both practices and measures to prevent the release of regulated substances.  In the event of a release, the Cimarron facility is prepared to work with the Gray County LEPC and/or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact to people and the environment.

2. Facility Information
The Cimarron facility's primary covered process activity is the storage of fertilizers.  This activity includes processing of anhydrous ammonia by a third-party company called Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC.  Anhydrous ammonia is received and processed into 10-34-0 non-hazardous liquid fertilizer.  Processing is periodic and usually occurs in the Spring and Fall.  Ammonia mixing with phosphoric acid occurs in a T-reactor owned and operated by Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC.  Water is used as both a reaction feed material and product stabilizer.  The emergency procedures for Cimarron are coordinated with the Gray County LEPC.

WinField United - Cimarron, KS has taken the necessary steps to comply with accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68.  The only process that this RMP includes is the storage of anhydrous ammonia. The T-reactor process is done entirely by Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC; and their process is also covered by OSHA's Process Safety Management standard.  

3. Accidental Release Prevention Program
The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  A robust inspection program has been implemented and the elements of the prevention program are tracked using an electronic EHS management system.

4. Five-Year Accident History.
